headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Sunrun, GMS, Oracle, HPE, Juniper Networks, Robinhood, Palantir, and More
summary: Sunrun is rising sharply after the Senate’s latest version of the tax-and-spending megabill includes some relatively positive changes for some companies in the solar industry, while GMS jumps after reaching an agreement to be acquired by Home Depot.

headline: Enphase Energy (NasdaqGM:ENPH) Soars 18% in One Week
summary: Enphase Energy (NasdaqGM:ENPH) has recently gained attention following its addition to the Russell 2500 Growth Index and Russell 2500 Index, as well as the launch of its IQ Battery 5P targeting several European markets. These developments, along with promising projects in the U.S., fortify its standing in the renewable energy sector. Over the past week, the company's stock rose by 18%, likely buoyed by these encouraging updates. This move outpaces the broader market's 3% climb, suggesting...

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Enphase, Tesla, Juniper Networks, Wells Fargo, Palantir, and More
summary: Clean energy stocks Enphase Energy and Sunrun decline after the Senate’s latest version of the tax-and-spending megabill would phase out tax credits for large-scale wind and solar projects by the end of 2027, earlier than in previous versions of the legislation.

headline: Stocks to Watch: Meta, Tesla, Wells Fargo, Boeing
summary: ↗️ GMS (GMS): The building-products distributor will be bought for about $4.3 billion by Home Depot (HD), which won a bidding war over QXO (QXO). GMS shares jumped 12% early Monday. ↗️ Goldman Sachs (GS), Wells Fargo (WFC): Both stocks rallied in after the Federal Reserve said late Friday that America’s large banks cleared its annual stress test.

headline: Renewable energy shares mixed as U.S. Senate preserves some tax credits in Trump bill
summary: (Reuters) -Shares of U.S. renewable energy firms saw a mixed performance in early Monday trading after the U.S. Senate advanced President Donald Trump's sweeping tax-and-spending bill.  The final version preserved tax credits for solar leasing  —  an arrangement where a third-party owns and installs a solar panel system on a customer's property for a fee to use the system and the electricity it generates.  Shares of solar panel maker First Solar rose 7.1% at $163.00 while battery firms Sunrun climbed 7.8% to $8.01 and Fluence Energy gained 3.1% to $6.33.

Shares of solar panel maker First Solar rose 7.1% at $163.00 while battery firms Sunrun climbed 7.8% to $8.01 and Fluence Energy gained 3.1% to $6.33.

headline: Solar stocks, Moderna, HPE: Trending Tickers
summary: Solar stocks such as Enphase (ENPH), SunRun (RUN), and SolarEdge (SEDG) are in focus as changes to the big beautiful bill could introduce new taxes on the industry. Moderna (MRNA) sees promising drug trial results for its combination flu shot and COVID-19 vaccine. HPE (HPE) has reached a settlement with the Department of Justice to allow it to proceed with its $14 billion acquisition of Juniper Networks (JNPR). Check out Yahoo Finance's interview with HPE CEO Antonio Neri here. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Big Beautiful Bill Weighs On Hospitals, Renewables Before Vote; S&P 500 Futures Rise
summary: President Donald Trump's One Big Beautiful Bill Act is expected to come to a vote in the Senate today and clear the House as soon as Wednesday.  The Senate also took a tougher line on renewable energy tax credits, which prompted Tesla CEO Elon Musk to weigh in against the bill.  The reality of the bill's tough trade-offs burst into the open on Sunday night, as Sen. Thom Tillis (R-N.C.) denounced Medicaid provisions that he said would cost his state $26 billion in support and kick 663,000 North Carolinians off their health plans.

headline: Senate budget plan ’very bearish’ for renewables, says Morgan Stanley
